map.string: Immediately upload snapshots saved to disk into your inventory as well.
Allow rendering impostor images, disabling this disables generating them and makes avatars invisible when they are impostored.
Allow the taskbar icon of Black Dragon to flash for a couple seconds when receiving new messages.
Allow cropping the snapshot when taking local snapshots to inventory.
Render more accurate light reflections on water. May introduce glow issues.
Show affecting status buttons at the bottom of the screen.
Controls upper limit of frames per second
Controls upper limit of VRAM (in MB) to be used by the Viewer.
Allow Return to execute the default inventory item action when an inventory item is selected.
Allow unsafe resolutions to be selected in the snapshot resolution dropdown.
Enable the old, slow, high quality Depth of Field.
Allow grabbing or touching objects in mouselook.
Force Chat editors into single line mode, disabling their auto expanding feature.
Enables automatically scaling system and scene memory according to how much the Viewer currently needs.
Allow the UI to hide when going into Mouselook mode

Use a realistic first person view, this prevents your camera from beeing the center of everything and your avatar always beeing locked below you, it allows your Avatar to move around freely in mouselook while your camera will follow it around. Prepare your seatbelts for an awesome shaky View! May break with certain super unrealistic animations.
Use a cinematic bone tracking camera in third person.
Angle between avatar facing and camera facing at which avatar turns to face same direction as camera, when in mouselook (degrees)
When in third person, moving mouse up looks down and vice verse (FALSE = moving up looks up)
Toggle the pie menu popup animation
Time in seconds the pie menu takes before its popup animation is complete
Opacity for the pie menu background
Fade out for the pie menu background towards the edges
Sound file for opening pie menu (uuid for sound asset)
Sound file for closing pie menu (uuid for sound asset)
Sound file for selecting pie menu item 0 (uuid for sound asset)
Sound file for selecting pie menu item 1 (uuid for sound asset)
Sound file for selecting pie menu item 2 (uuid for sound asset)
Sound file for selecting pie menu item 3 (uuid for sound asset)
Sound file for selecting pie menu item 4 (uuid for sound asset)
Sound file for selecting pie menu item 5 (uuid for sound asset)
Sound file for selecting pie menu item 6 (uuid for sound asset)
Sound file for selecting pie menu item 7 (uuid for sound asset)
Debug option to show/hide the changelogs on the login screen.
Debug option to open the Machinima Sidebar
Weither we should sort the Inventory by Name or not.
Weither we should sort the Inventory objects by date or not.
Weither we should sort the Inventory folders by Name or not.
Move System folders always to the top.
Raw shadow width and height of each of the four shadow maps, closest (X), mid (Y), far (Z) furthest. (W)
Enable blurring the foreground with Depth of Field.
Set the number of color shades used for rendering the scene.
Set the percentual amount of greyscale's strength, 1.0 means fully greyscale , 0.0 means fully colored
Set the percentual amount of sepia's strength, 1.0 means a full sepia tone, 0.0 means no sepia tone at all.
Set the strength of chromatic abberation.
Toggles Mouse-steering mode to always on as if you click and hold down your Mouse on your Avatar while moving the Mouse
Toggles between old automatic shadow clip plane scaling or fully customizable one.
Use pass 2 in alpha rendering when depth of field is enabled.
Set the strength of all lights in the world, both spherical and spotlights.
Switch IM window tabs to the left side
Controls time factor for Slow Motion animations
Hide the Local Chat floater automatically whenever it loses focus
Hide the Local Chat floater whenever you press the return key, no matter if the Chat is empty or not
Allow your Avatar to turn around to face the camera when walking backwards, instead of only when running.
Controls rotation speed of your Avatar , smaller values result in eventually breaking turn animations in AO's and a more direct control feeling
Timespan for interpolating between Windlight settings
Display range ring on mini map
Show World Map legend and controls
Allow MU* pose style in chat and IM
Switch between right and left hand when editing an object.
Enable using flycam mode like Depth of Field focus point selection via mouse cursor in normal camera mode.
Enable using flycam mode like Depth of Field focus point selection via mouse cursor in normal camera mode.
Percentage which to clamp camera roll back towards straight up.
Percentage which to clamp camera roll back towards straight up while sitting.
Allow the camera to roll and flip upside down while sitting..
Toggles rendering the environment map on shiny surfaces in Deferred Rendering.
Raw projector shadow width of the two available shadow maps
Fade out volumetric lighting if we don't face the sun.
This enables and disables Lens Flare effects from the sun.
Dont allow sitting down when left clicking objects.
Dont allow grabbing objects when left clicking-and-holding objects.
Show either entire world coordinates or local sim coordinates on minimap
Show the legend panel on the world map floater
Remember the last used snapshot mode in our snapshot floater
Render lighted prims that are attached to other avatars
Render lighted prims that are attached to other avatars
Render lighted prims that are attached to other avatars
Render the reflection of spotlight projections on shiny surfaces with environment enabled
Render the reflection of spotlight projections on shiny surfaces with environment enabled
Invert pitch axis in all joystick modes.
Cloud Noise image name that should be used for windlight cloud generation
Run SL in a fullscreen window
Amount to "correct" exposure by every frame until we've reached the target exposure in ExodusRenderExposureTarget.
Target exposure level for auto exposure. Only applied when ExodusRenderAutoExposure is set to TRUE.
Whether or not to enable auto exposure. Note: autoexposure is slightly more expensive, and may not work on all GPUs and drivers.
Advanced tone mapping options. X = Shoulder strength, Y = Linear strength, Z = Linear angle.
Advanced tone mapping options (cont'd). X = Toe strength, Y = Toe numerator, Z = Toe denominator.
Advanced tone mapping options (cont'd). X = Linear white point, Y = Exposure bias.
This enables and disables Tone Mapping.
Tone mapping technique to use. 0 applies Filmic, 1 applies Linear, and 2 applies Reinhard. Defaults to Reinhard.
Color grading technique to use. 0 applies linear color correction, 1 applies a 1D color gammut LUT, 2 does nothing (yet), -1 disables color grading altogether. Defaults to linear.
Image to use for color grading post process. Note: this should always be a gradient with alpha. (UUID texture reference)
Amount of vignette to apply (X), power of vignette shading (Y), and multiplier for vignette shading (Z).
High Dynamic Range Exposure. Each value represents a different color channel.
High Dynamic Range Gamma Correction. Each value represents a different color channel.
High Dynamic Range Brightness Offset. Each value represents a different color channel. Higher values brighten the scene, lower values darken.
Controls what should be included into Motion Blur rendering. 0 = Objects only, 1 = Objects and self, 2 = Everything.
Client control settings file name (per install).
Enable/disable updating the selection outlines every few seconds.
Resets the UI scale factor on first run due to changed display scaling behavior
Show Avatar performance rank in nametags.
(EXPERIMENTAL) Scale down head bones on entering mouselook to prevent rigged head attachments being visible and clipping into the camera.
Installation folder for Firestorm Viewer to look into for new windlight presets.
Installation folder for Alchemy Viewer to look into for new windlight presets.
Installation folder for Catznip Viewer to look into for new windlight presets.
Installation folder for the Second Life Viewer to look into for new windlight presets.
App user folder for Firestorm Viewer to look into for new windlight presets.
App user folder for Alchemy Viewer to look into for new windlight presets.
App user folder for Catznip Viewer to look into for new windlight presets.
App user folder for the Second Life Viewer to look into for new windlight presets.
Allow searching for presets in the configured Firestorm folder.
Allow searching for presets in the configured Alchemy folder.
Allow searching for presets in the configured Catznip folder.
Allow searching for presets in the configured Second Life folder.
